intro: Chimaphila monticola var. taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan ghost orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, characterized by its evergreen shrub form and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a unique lip-like petal. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions with acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
